results.title: The Pastfinders
results.brief_description: A drama set in the future, 1000 years from the twentieth century, when coins are found and the information fed into a computer it triggers its memory bank - what the coin was used for so long ago. This opening is a novel way to start a film about the dangers of cigarette smoking in the twentieth century. It shows the effects of smoking of human beings and the deaths caused by lung cancer.

results.title: The Passion to play
results.creator_credit: Rob Dickson, Peter Dickson and Hush Productions International
results.brief_description: Sport has the power to unite and also to divide. It has the ability to build a person’s confidence and at the same time destroy another’s spirit. Australian Rules Football has for generations provided individuals and communities with a distraction from the normal focus of life. Created by our natural desire for competition, it has thrilled the masses, and for many, provided a way of life. It is the players that determine its power and this video is a celebration of those players. Players past and present, representing the 16 different clubs, discuss the game and their careers, providing insight into the journey of playing Australian Rules Football as a senior, the thrill of the first game and the heartache of being told your time is up.

results.title: The Passion of Spain
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Grainger Maynard and Maynard
results.brief_description: As seen on ATN 7 on “The world around us”, this is a tour through Spain, looking at the diverse mix of ancient Spanish traditions and the new vibrancy which has swept through the country. Witness spectacular fairs and parades, as well as looking at the remote areas of the country, such as Galica, the Basque homelands and Gomera in the Canary Islands.

results.title: The Passing of remoteness
results.creator_credit: Robert Hone, BBC-TV and WGBH Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The dream machine”.
Computers are continuously changing the way humans interact and have become an integral part of our lives, however, technology often comes into conflict with social systems. This program examines the way “Information Technology” has impacted on our everyday lives, raising controversial issues relating to the monitoring of individuals and their right to privacy, disruptions caused by faulty data and the catastrophic effect of software errors. Looks at Singapore’s “Information Technology Society”, France’s national computer network and the effect of “Electronic Trading” in Stock Markets. Our future is Digital but will technology control humans?

results.title: The Passing of King George VI
results.brief_description: Thousands pay homage to the memory of their beloved King George VI at Westminster Abbey. Also includes footage of funeral procession to historic Windsor, the last resting place.

results.title: The Party
results.creator_credit: Paul Sutherland, McGraw-Hill Films and Riverbank Productions
results.brief_description: Hammy and Roddy give a party in their home - the well furnished and comfortable interior of an old shoe. After dinner and games the guests leave, Hammy and Roddy relax beofre a fire. Roddy, hearing a srange sound, rushes outside to find Guinea Pig in his flying balloon caught in a tree. They rescue him with a ladder, and a grateful Guinea Pig settles down to enjoy his friends’ hospitality.

results.title: The Parent crunch (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Heart of Teaching”.
Uses a dramatization involving a teacher and a parent who is angry over his child’s achievement in school to present problems teachers must meet in communicating with parents and others. From the series “The Heart of teaching”.

results.title: The Parallax view [NTSC]
results.brief_description: The second film in Pakula’s “paranoia” trilogy (falling between “Klute” (1971) and “All the President’s Men” (1976), is a disquieting suspense thriller that refers directly to conspiracy theories surrounding the Kennedy assassination. After a presidential candidate is assassinated, witnesses to the seemingly random crime begin dying mysteriously, including the girlfriend of a political journalist. The journalist’s investigation into the deaths uncovers a conspiracy of huge proportions that has at its centre a covert organisation known as the Parallax Corporation. He infiltrates the organisation becoming increasingly isolated and paranoid as he is drawn more deeply into its elaborate machinations. Pakula’s repeated use of opaque structures that partially obscure the screen, white-outs, off-kilter shots and disorientating editing patterns point to the impossibility of gaining access to any objective truth in this claustrophobic world where the line between reality and perception can no longer be discerned. The bleakest of the trilogy it was, unlike the other two films, a box-office failure. Cast: Warren Beatty, Hume Cronyn, William Daniels, Kenneth Mars, Walter, McGinn, Kelly Thordsen, Jim Davis.

results.title: The Paperback computer
results.creator_credit: Jon Palfreman, Robert Hone, BBC-TV and WGBH Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The dream machine”.
Explores the technological developments and the innovative research that paved the way for the Personal Computer Revolution of the 80’s. Focuses on the role hobbyists such as Steve Jobs and Stephen Wozniak (Co-founders of Apple Computer Company) played in making computers accessible with the introduction of the Macintosh in 1984. Examines the failure of companies such as Xerox and IBM to recognise potential markets outside the business and science arena and their failure to commercialise research discoveries in the 60’s and 70’s. Looks at the impact of PC’s and their extensive applications in today’s society and considers the endless possibilities for the future.
